alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Somerset and southwestern Worcester Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pocomoke City, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, West Pocomoke, Westover, Cokesbury, Eden, Rehobeth, Kingston, Allen, Manokin, Longridge, Beaver Dam and Whitesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
